728158f-a.text:
Vernon Boulevard, adjoining the S.W. Corner of 36th Avenue, showing an old mansion. It first appears in an 1891 atlas, when this area was still a fashionable residential district.
March 9, 1931
P.L. Sperr

728159f-c.text:
Vernon Boulevard, west side, just north of 36th Avenue, on the East River waterfront, showing the S. Upson mansion of 1875.  It later became the Witherspoon mansion and was part of the Witherspoon Plaster Mills in 1909.  Views 1 and 4 show the rear of the house, looking toward the river from Vernon Boulevard.

View 1: Eugene L. Armburster Collection   April 1925  MAY BE REPRODUCED

Views 2 - 4 F. L. Sparr  NO REPRODUCTIONS
Views 2, 3: November 6, 1930
View 4: March 9, 1931

View 1: Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
April, 1925

November 6, 1930
